page.title: 13 BRIDGES
page.content: From{Mitford}to the centre of Morpeth,the{River Wansbeck}is crossed several times by a variety of bridges. Old arched stone road bridges cross the river at{Mitford}and{Highford.}In stark comparison modern concrete and metal constuction appears carrying the A1 road over the river. The road bends sharply to cross the narrow,{Lowford bridge},with its three arches and stone walls on either side.Further along there is{Skinnery {bridge},a footbridge which is of a metal constuction,erected in{1904.} Downstream we come to the{stepping {stones}then{Oldgate bridge,}a stone arched road bridge built in{1970.} Originally it was a metalchain bridge built in{1826.} Finally in our territory is the{ {Elliot bridge,}a metal construction footbridge,opened by{Sir W.Elliot M.P.
